JobFullDesc: The Product Management Implementation Senior Manager is responsible for operational ownership of all benefit and product implementations, including monitoring changes in regulatory requirements and national coverage determinations that impact claims coding and benefits setups and conducting post|implementation testing and ongoing auditing to ensure accuracy. Additionally, this position will work cross functionally to implement and track Medicare cost savings efforts. Also, the incumbent will serve as primary operational owner for the Fully Integrated Duals Advantage plan ensuring that all aspects across departments are in|line with contractual obligations and ensuring that the product delivers on member satisfaction as well as retention.Duties & Responsibilities:Manages the annual Medicare product and benefit implementation, including coordinating closely with both our Ancillary team and Benefits Management team to ensure benefit changes are updated in our/our vendors' systems according to the annual CMS bid/benefit filing.Ensures accuracy of benefit changes and timely production of all implementations prior to the January 1st "go live" deadline.Monitors changes in National Coverage Determinations, Medicare Claims and Policy Manual updates, etc., and collaborates with all of the impacted business areas to ensure that our claims coding, mapping, and setups are accurate and up to date and that our benefits are being administered appropriately.  Works with the benefit administration team to review results of internal audits and monitoring to ensure accuracy of claims adjudication and benefit administration, such as ensuring accurate calculation and tracking of members' mandatory Maximum Out Of Pocket (MOOP) spend.Acts as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) of our various products, benefits, exclusions, and systems and assists business areas as needed with related inquiries and interdepartmental training, as well as actively participates in our Benefits Committee.Identifies and works cross functional to implement Medicare cost savings efforts.   Support auditing and validation efforts to ensure that intended savings are realized.  assist with establishing new processes for key initiatives and auditing once implemented to determine outcomes.Serve as primary operational owner for the Fully Integrated Duals Advantage plan.  Work across the organization to ensure that all aspects of the program are in place and delivered in a compliant manner.  Assist Regulatory and other departments in preparation for audits and monthly CMS/NYSDOH status meetings. Identify and work cross functionally to implement changes in the administration of the FIDA program in order to improve member satisfaction as well as retention.Minimum QualificationsBA/BS degree; over 5 years of experience; or any combination of education and experience that would provide an equivalent backgroundExposure to the healthcare industry and value-based careMust be able to successfully facilitate sound business objectives within highly regulated industryStrong public speaking and oral and written communication skills, with experience communicating complex messages to executive-level audiencesExperience leading teams, including both managers and individual contributors, to identify opportunities, develop plan of action, and executeAbility to coordinate and motivate people to achieve resultsAbility to train, coach and develop staff to accomplish established goalsKnowledge of current healthcare marketplace strategies and tools (Specifically, knowledge in Medicaid, MLTC and/or Commercial markets preferred)Knowledge of insurance regulatory and contractual requirementsPreferred QualificationsLeadership experience in the insurance industry, hospital/health system management and/or managed care/private network product management or equivalent in lieu of experienceMaster’s or a Professional degree MBA/MD/JDExperience creating project plans and workflowsWE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.
